card.name: Hyperspatial Bolshack Hole
card.text: ■ Destroy one of your opponent’s creatures that has 3000 power or less. ■ Choose one of the following. :► Put any number of psychic creatures that have total cost 5 or less from your hyperspatial zone into the battle zone. :► Put a fire psychic creature that costs 7 or less from your hyperspatial zone into the battle zone. ■ Hyperspatial Psychic

card.name: Bolshack Dragon, the Temporal Blaze
card.text: ■ While attacking, this creature gets +1000 power for each fire card in your graveyard. ■ Double Breaker ■ Awaken—When this creature wins a battle, Bolshack Möbius, Victory Awakened

card.name: Bolshack Möbius, Victory Awakened
card.text: ■ Whenever this creature attacks, you may put one of your shields into your graveyard. If you do, you may destroy one of your opponent's creatures that has power 6000 or less. ■ Each turn, you may untap this creature the first time it is tapped. ■ While attacking, this creature gets +1000 power for each fire card in your graveyard. ■ Triple Breaker ■ Release

card.name: Bolshack Möbius, Victory Awakened
card.text: ■ Whenever this creature attacks, you may put one of your shields into your graveyard. If you do, you may destroy one of your opponent's creatures that has power 6000 or less. ■ Each turn, you may untap this creature the first time it is tapped. ■ While attacking, this creature gets +1000 power for each fire card in your graveyard. ■ Triple Breaker ■ Release

card.name: Death April, the Awakened Requiem
card.text: ■ Whenever this creature attacks, your opponent chooses a card from their hand and discards it. ■ Double Breaker

card.name: April, Temporal Gunprincess
card.text: ■ Awaken—When this creature attacks your opponent and isn't blocked, your opponent chooses a card from their hand and discards it. After the attack, Death April, the Awakened Requiem ■ Hyperspatial Psychic

card.name: Cyber G Hogan
card.text: ■ Double Breaker ■ Chain Cascade ''(When you put this creature into the battle zone, look at the top 2 cards of your deck. If any of those cards are creatures that cost less than this creature, you may put them into the battle zone. Put the rest of the cards on top of your deck in any order.)''

card.name: Tornado Shiva Double Cross, Blastdragon
card.text: ■ Whenever your opponent chooses this creature, search your deck. You may take a creature that has Double Cross in its name from your deck, show that creature to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your deck. ■ Whenever this creature attacks, you may choose 2 creatures in the battle zone. Those creatures battle. ''(They don't tap to battle.)'' ■ Double Breaker

card.name: Shadow Sword "Yagyuu" Dragon
card.text: ■ When you put this creature, untap all Dragons in your mana zone. ■ If you have tooltip

card.name: Flame Shiva Double Cross, Blastdragon
card.text: ■ Your psychic creatures that cost 5 or less can't be blocked. ■ Whenever this creature attacks, search your deck. You may take a spell that has Hyperspatial in its name from your deck, show that spell to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your deck.

card.name: Hyperspatial Energy Hole
card.text: ■ Draw a card. ■ Choose one of the following. :► Put any number of psychic creatures that have total cost 5 or less from your hyperspatial zone into the battle zone. :► Put a water psychic creature that costs 7 or less from your hyperspatial zone into the battle zone. ■ Hyperspatial Psychic

card.name: Hyperspatial Faerie Hole
card.text: ■ Put the top card of your deck into your mana zone. ■ Choose one of the following. :► Put any number of psychic creatures that have total cost 5 or less from your hyperspatial zone into the battle zone. :► Put a nature psychic creature that costs 7 or less from your hyperspatial zone into the battle zone. ■ Hyperspatial Psychic

card.name: Hyperspatial Revive Hole
card.text: ■ Return a creature from your graveyard to your hand. ■ Choose one of the following. :► Put any number of psychic creatures that have total cost 5 or less from your hyperspatial zone into the battle zone. :► Put a darkness psychic creature that costs 7 or less from your hyperspatial zone into the battle zone. ■ Hyperspatial Psychic

card.name: Hyperspatial Shiny Hole
card.text: ■ Choose one of your opponent's creatures in the battle zone and tap it. ■ Choose one of the following. :► Put any number of psychic creatures that have total cost 5 or less from your hyperspatial zone into the battle zone. :► Put a light psychic creature that costs 7 or less from your hyperspatial zone into the battle zone. ■ Hyperspatial Psychic

card.name: Great Chakra, the Storm Awakened
card.text: ■ Blocker ■ Holy Field Ignore any effects that would prevent your creatures that have "blocker" from attacking. (''However, summoning sickness isn't ignored.'') ■ Triple Breaker ■ Release

card.name: Chakra, Temporal Thunder Dragon
card.text: ■ Blocker ■ This creature can't attack players. ■ Holy Field Awaken—At the Step#Step 2 (Draw)

card.name: Dark Strike, Reaper Beast
card.text: ■ When this creature is destroyed, you may put a Demon Command that costs 7 or less from your hand into the battle zone.

card.name: Guard Grip
card.text: ■ Draw a card.

card.name: Bloody Cross
card.text: ■ Put the top 2 cards of your deck into your graveyard. Then your opponent puts the top 2 cards of their deck into their graveyard.

card.name: Tailspin Slash
card.text: ■ Each of your creatures in the battle zone get "speed attacker" until the End Step

card.name: Alephtina, Spiritual Princess
card.text: ■ This creature costs 1 more to summon for each of your shields. ■ Whenever your opponent's creatures attack you for the first time in a turn and you have no shields, add the top card of your deck to your shields face down. ■ If you have 10 or more shields, you Alternate Win ■ Double Breaker

card.name: Necrodragon End of the World
card.text: ■ Double Breaker ■ When you put this creature, search your deck. Choose 3 cards from it, and put the rest into your graveyard. Then put the 3 chosen cards on top of your deck in any order.

card.name: Cyber A Irons
card.text: ■ When you put this creature into the battle zone, draw up to 5 cards. ■ Whenever you put other water creatures into the battle zone, this creature can't be blocked that turn. ■ Triple Breaker

card.name: Baban Ban Ban, Earth's Blessing
card.text: ■ When you put this creature into the battle zone, count the number of cards in your mana zone. You may put that many cards from the top of your deck into your mana zone tapped. ■ Double Breaker ■ Mana Reburst

card.name: Deadly Love
card.text: ■ Shield Trigger ■ You may destroy one of your creatures. If you do, destroy one of your opponent's creatures.

card.name: Future Blueprint
card.text: ■ Shield Trigger ■ Look at the top 6 cards of your deck. You may choose a creature from them, show that creature to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Then put the rest on the bottom of your deck in any order.

card.name: Rolan, the Oracle
card.text: ■ This creature costs 1 less to summon for each of your shields. It can't cost less than 1. ■ If you have 2 shields or less, this creature gets +4000 power and has "Blocker".

card.name: Luna Mystery Mansion
card.text: ■ When you put this creature into the battle zone, choose one of the following. :► Choose a castle fortifying a player's shield and return it to its owner's hand. :► Choose a card in the battle zone that costs the same as or less than the number of Soul

card.name: Alligator, the Awakened Flower Beast
card.text: ■ Whenever this creature attacks, put the top card of your deck into your mana zone. ■ Double Breaker

card.name: Caiman, Temporal Flower
card.text: ■ Awaken—Whenever this creature attacks your opponent and isn't blocked, put the top card of your deck into your mana zone. After the attack, Alligator, the Awakened Flower Beast ■ Hyperspatial Psychic

card.name: JK Great Gamble
card.text: ■ Play Rock-Paper-Scissors with your opponent. If you win, search your deck. For each of your creatures in the battle zone, you may take a creature that has the same name from your deck and put it into the battle zone. Then shuffle your deck. If you lose Rock-Paper-Scissors, destroy all your creatures.

card.name: Goemonkey! Snake-Handed Boss
card.text: ■ When you put this creature into the battle zone, you may summon creatures from your mana zone this turn.

card.name: Leaf Storm Trap
card.text: ■ Shield Trigger ■ Choose one of your creatures in the battle zone and put it into your mana zone. Then choose one of your opponent's creatures in the battle zone and put into its owner's mana zone.

card.name: Nakatsumaki, Godly Guns Elemental
card.text: ■ Blocker ■ Double Breaker

card.name: Deepsea Dober
card.text: ■ Blocker ■ This creature can't attack. ■ Your creatures that have Command in their race each cost 1 less to summon. They can't cost less than 1.

card.name: Aqua Jester Loupe
card.text: ■ Chain ■ If this creature or one of your other creatures is the second creature put into the battle zone during your turn, you may draw a card.

card.name: Haunted Choice
card.text: ■ Shield Trigger ■ Look at the top card of a player's deck. You may put that card into its owner's graveyard. ■ Draw a card.

card.name: Burial Worm, the Burying Insect
card.text: ■ Blocker ■ This creature can't attack. ■ At the Step#Step 2 (Draw)

card.name: Project God
card.text: ■ Put the top 5 cards of your deck into your graveyard. If there are Gods among these cards that are able to link with one of your Gods in the battle zone, you may put those Gods into the battle zone and link it with that God.
